entry.title: Dashboard and Business AI Insights for SAP License Simulation and Analysis
entry.content:
Introduction

SAP has introduced the SAM4U solution, an excellent tool to gather data from SAP backend systems for the consolidation and analysis of users, engines, and HANA EE license consumption.

The Accelerator for SAM4U Adoption, available on SAP Store, provides extended analytics and simulation capabilities to view SAM4U data from new angles. It empowers customers moving to S/4HANA, S/4HANA Private Cloud, or already working under an SAP RISE contract to run different ‚Äúwhat if‚Äù scenarios based on data extracted from their SAP system, helping them find the best approach to optimize SAP license consumption.

What Was Missing?

While SAM4U provides valuable transparency, customers often asked:

  • How do I see the potential savings?

  • How do I define a strategy for optimization?

  • Where exactly should I focus my cleanup efforts?

License optimization typically falls into three categories:

  • Fast optimization: achieved quickly with user data cleanup in SAP backend

  • Obtainable optimization: achievable in reasonable time with cleanup and role/profile tuning

  • Maximal optimization: the long-term goal, achieved when roles and authorizations are precisely aligned with actual usage

What was missing was clarity and insights to navigate these paths effectively.

How it is solved

The new release of the Accelerator for SAM4U Adoption brings two major updates:

  • Clarity through an extremely informative dashboard

  • Business AI insights powered by the Skybuffer AI platform, an SAP Business AI certified solution from SAP Store

The dashboard

This is the highlight. The dashboard presents clear KPIs on one page, helping to get insights into current estimated spending and estimated savings, following both fast and obtainable strategies.

 Pic. 1 The Dashboard

One of the central KPIs is License Optimization Potential, which shows the estimated current contract costs compared to optimized contract costs. The KPI highlights savings that can be achieved either through the fast users cleanup approach or the obtainable approach of cleaning up users and optimizing roles with the highest optimization potential.

 Pic. 2 License Optimization Potential

There are many other useful insights. For example, it shows how many authorization objects are not used at all. This is a target for maximal optimization and one reason it is not so easily obtainable. The lower the number, the better the authorizations are aligned with active usage.

 Pic. 3 Excess Authorization

The evaluation of maximal optimization is also visualized by the FUE Gap KPI:

 Pic. 4 FUE Gap - Authorization vs Active Usage

There is also a very helpful hint about SAP_ALL and SAP_NEW profiles still in use in production:

 Pic. 5 Users with Sensitive Authorization Profiles

The total number of roles and profiles that can be optimized and the savings this brings are also clearly summarized:

 Pic. 6 Excess Roles

The insights

Business AI insights in the dashboard bring extra clarity and understanding. For example, they show the fast optimization saving potential and provide clear explanations and strategies on how to reach it:

Pic. 7 Business AI Insights

AI recommendations are also available for obtainable or maximal optimization:

 Pic. 8 Max and Obtainable Optimization

Effectively, this functions as a personal SAP License Analysis and Optimization consultant, virtualized and trained to understand the organization‚Äôs own data.

The AI Assistant is always there, and expanding its knowledge base is straightforward through the Skybuffer AI platform. For example, it can present the top 10 roles for optimization or provide additional information related to SAP licensing:

 Pic. 9 Top 10 Roles for Optimization

Of course, all the well-established simulation and analysis tools of the Accelerator remain available. With the new release, they work even better, helping to test and simulate the AI Assistant‚Äôs recommendations.

Conclusion

The Accelerator for SAM4U Adoption now provides one of the most powerful toolsets on the market to analyze and optimize SAP users and engines licenses independently. It helps avoid the significant costs of SAP license optimization consulting and delivers deep insights into user and engine data. This comes without the need for a complex SAM4U installation and without spending time and money on consulting services that quickly become outdated.

What to do next?

Running SAP under a RISE contract? Use the dashboard and Business AI insights at least once per month to avoid FUE consumption increases and surprises. Train your team with the solution and the organization will not face unpredictable growth of SAP license consumption. Leave consulting for the exceptional case when the company grows faster than its SAP role set. üòâ

entry.title: ABAP AI - Chapter 2
entry.content:
Summary

  • New ABAP AI capabilities keep coming
  • Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities remain free of charge
  • Availability of ABAP AI in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition in release 2025 is ahead of us
  • ABAP AI will be available in older releases of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition as well, details and updates expected at TechEd.

In February 2025, we started the first chapter of ABAP AI and announced that Joule speaks ABAP. Now, it‚Äôs time to get ready for chapter 2!

In the past months, we have been delivering more Joule skills to speed up ABAP Cloud development, and we are now able to create RAP business objects ‚Äì from the database table up to the UI service powered by generative AI. We can create unit tests, explain code, complete code in the editor, implement validations and determinations, and much more (see also our public slide deck). All these skills are part of the 2508 release of SAP BTP ABAP Environment and SAP Cloud ERP (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition), and they will be included in the SAP Cloud ERP Private (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition) in the 2025 release. Please check out our updated tutorial on ABAP AI capabilities. In addition, we will continue to expand our AI scope and will deliver on the transformation aspect of our AI strategy. This starts with the 2025 delivery for SAP Cloud ERP Private, followed by AI capabilities in the custom code migration app in SAP BTP ABAP Environment 2602. Please visit our roadmap to keep track of our deliveries.

Let‚Äôs continue with commercials and keep it short: The free promotions we introduced at the beginning of the year have been extended until further notice! We are convinced that, in the current situation, we don‚Äôt want to put any commercial barriers on our offering and let all customers and partners benefit from AI-driven development. The corresponding material numbers for customers 8019124 and TDD partners 8019541 remain the same and can be ordered again. For those who started before the extension of the promotion, note that a re-ordering of the material is required. The procedure for the SAP BTP ABAP Environment and SAP Cloud ERP remains the same as well, and the initial blog post has been updated to reflect this, as well as SAP Note 3571857.
For SAP Cloud ERP Private, as of release 2025, the material numbers are also valid. However, the configuration will need to be done manually by you. Detailed information on this will follow.

But that is not enough. Will ABAP AI capabilities become available also for older releases of SAP Cloud ERP Private? Yes!
Imagine an ABAP AI service running side-by-side to your ABAP instance, providing full access to ABAP AI capabilities across hybrid landscapes. This includes SAP BTP ABAP Environment, SAP Cloud ERP, and SAP Cloud ERP Private. New AI innovations become available independently of release upgrades or support packages, allowing immediate leveraging.  Best of all, this ABAP AI service can also be connected to older releases of SAP Cloud ERP Private.

Sounds like a dream? Let‚Äôs find out ‚Äì stay tuned for TechEd 2025 to receive all the news and updates!

entry.title: How to Add Custom Tables for Local Extensions Calculation in SAP Variant Configuration & Pricing
entry.content:
SAP Variant Configuration & Pricing (VC&P) is a powerful tool for managing complex product configurations. Often, standard tables may not suffice for specific business logic, and you may need to introduce custom tables to support local extensions in pricing or configuration calculations.

This blog walks you through the steps to add a custom table and use it effectively in your local extensions logic.

Why Use Custom Tables?

Custom tables allow you to:

  • Store additional data not available in standard SAP tables.
  • Implement business-specific logic.
  • Enhance flexibility in pricing or configuration rules.

Step-by-Step Guide

Step 1: Create the Custom Table in SAP

Use transaction SE11 to create a transparent table.

  • Define fields relevant to your logic (e.g., product ID, region, surcharge).
  • Set appropriate data types and key fields.
  • Activate the table.

Step 2: Populate the Table

Use SM30 or a custom program to maintain entries in your table.

Step 3: Create a Function Module or ABAP Class

This will serve as the interface between your custom table and the VC&P logic.

  • Use SE37 or SE24.
  • Read data from your custom table based on input parameters.
  • Return the required value (e.g., surcharge, discount).

Step 4: Register the Function Module in VC&P

In the VC&P environment 

  • Go to the Local Extensions section.
  • Upload your javascript file in uploaded zip file and Register your function module or class.
  • Mapped input/output parameters.
  • Active Local Extensions - you will see the Function Name which will be active 

Step 5: Use the Custom Table in Calculation Logic

Now you can use your custom logic in:

  • Pricing procedures
  • Configuration rules
  • Condition records

Step 6: Add the Custom Tables 

Step 1 - Click on Tables from left menu - 2nd Tab - Custom tables

Step 2 - (Important Disclaimer and must to read) and Click Next

Step 3 - Add the custom tables in table list row by row and Click Submit and Select checkbox - Next Step

Step 4 - Custom table added will process and trigger to update the records into tables - you will see Running Queue starts

Example Use Case

Imagine you want to apply a regional surcharge based on the product and customer location. Your custom table might look like:

Product ID Region Surcharge (%)
P1001EU5
P1001US7
Your function module reads this table and returns the surcharge to be applied in the pricing logic.

Best Practices

  • Use naming conventions for custom objects.
  • Document your logic clearly.
  • Test thoroughly in a sandbox before moving to production.

entry.title: Release Navigator for SAP Cloud ERP Private ‚Äì What‚Äôs New in Q3 2025
entry.content:
Greetings Community!

I am excited to announce the upcoming 2025 FPS00 release for SAP Cloud ERP (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition), scheduled for October. To ensure a smooth transition and help you prepare for the upgrade, the release navigator for SAP Cloud ERP Private will be undergoing enhancements over the next month. These updates will include new UX features and content designed to support your readiness journey. As a reminder, all updates to the release navigator are completely automated and taken care by SAP Enterprise Support.

Topics

  1. Quick Links
  2. New Topics & Content
  3. New & Refreshed UX Features
  4. Release Navigator Innovation Plan
  5. Connect with Us

 

Click on the links below to access each resource:

 

Additional Sub-Topics for Supply Chain

In October, I am happy to share the expansion of our Supply Chain page with two new, highly requested sub-topics:

  1. Extended Warehouse Management (EWM)
  2. Transportation Management (TM)

Within these sub-topics, users will have access to curated release content aligned with the 2025 FPS00 updates. This enhancement aims to provide a more comprehensive and detailed resource hub, enabling you to stay informed about the latest developments in these critical areas of supply chain management.

 

Extended Warehouse Management for Supply Chain

Under the EWM sub-topic on the Supply Chain page, you will find the following resources:

  1. What‚Äôs New Viewer
  2. Release Blog
  3. Help Portal
  4. Onboarding Resource Center

 

 Transportation Management for Supply Chain

Under the TM sub-topic on the Supply Chain page, you will find the following resources:

  1. What‚Äôs New Viewer
  2. Release Blog
  3. Help Portal
  4. Onboarding Resource Center

 

SAP Activate Interactive Framework for Upgrades

The SAP Activate Road Map serves as an indispensable guide for SAP Cloud ERP Private customers, expertly navigating them through the intricacies of upgrade phases, deliverables, tasks, and accelerators. Aligned with the SAP Cloud Framework, it clearly outlines responsibilities for customers and partners, facilitating enhanced features, robust security, and seamless collaboration under a unified governance model.

For those seeking a comprehensive view of the tasks required for a smooth upgrade, the interactive framework offers an intuitive solution. Users can select from a range of upgrade tasks to gain a clear understanding of the necessary steps, ensuring a well-organized and efficient upgrade process.

 

 

All Pages

Search

I am excited to introduce a new search button conveniently located in the shell bar of all pages, designed to help you quickly locate release content for topics of interest. Simply:

  1. Open the search window
  2. Enter the desired topic
  3. Click on the relevant resource to view the corresponding content.

Should you encounter any difficulties in finding a specific topic, we encourage you to submit a request through our user feedback page.

 

Product Specific Page

Release Calendar

I am also happy to announce that the release calendar within the Product Specific page has been revamped with a fresh design. It now offers a more detailed view of the release schedule, allowing you to see the specific week when releases will be made available to customers. This granular insight enables you to plan and prepare more effectively for upcoming updates.

 

General Page

Content Structure

We have restructured the General page to better serve your needs. It is now organized by SAP Activate phases, providing clear guidance on when to utilize specific resources during each phase. This alignment with the Road Map Viewer is designed to enhance your navigation experience and ensure you have the right information at the right time.

 

About this Card

I would also like to highlight an additional feature on the General page that enhances your understanding of each resource. You can now access more information about each resource by simply selecting the triple dot icon located at the bottom of each card. This toggle function allows you to reveal or hide further details as needed, ensuring you have all the relevant information at your fingertips.

 

This section provides information regarding the release navigator only. For more detailed information on product release dates, please refer to the Release Calendar card on the Product Specific page.

 Disclaimer: These dates are for informational purposes only and may change. The Readiness@Scale team has the final decision over any UX modifications. Thank you for understanding.

 

We value your input and encourage you to share any feedback or specific content requests for future updates to the release navigator. Please feel free to complete our feedback survey or contribute your suggestions in the Comments section below this post.

To explore more about how the Readiness@Scale team is dedicated to overseeing release readiness within the SAP Enterprise Support portfolio, visit our Release Ready page. Additionally, you can find all our team's blog posts by searching the tag  Readiness@Scale. Thank you for your continued engagement and support.

 

Always bring your best,

Andrew Ford
SAP Enterprise Support

entry.title: ABAP AI Revolution Accelerates: The ABAP Developer Who Built Enterprise Apps in Minutes
entry.content:
The ABAP AI revolution just got a massive functionality upgrade and stays FREE OF CHARGE for another year

Remember John, our seasoned ABAP developer who discovered the power of Joule for AI-assisted coding? His journey has taken an incredible turn. What started as relief from "quick questions" and real-time assistance has evolved into something he never imagined possible ‚Äì building entire applications and transforming legacy systems through conversation in minutes. 

John's incredible journey is about to accelerate even further with game-changing news: Joule for Developers remains FREE OF CHARGE for another year ‚Äì the promotion has been extended with no commercial barriers, allowing every customer and partner to benefit from AI-driven development through material numbers 8019124 (customers) and 8019541 (TDD partners). This offer is now available not only for the BTP ABAP environments (Steampunk) and SAP Cloud ERP Public, but also to our SAP Cloud ERP Private customers using the latest 2025 release version. For a deep dive in more commercial details see ABAP AI - Chapter 2 blog written by my colleague @AlexanderRother 

See John's ABAP AI complete evolution with 2505, 2508 and 2025 ABAP releases:

  • The Game-Changer: ABAP Cloud Application Generation
  • Intelligent Business Logic with RAP Business Logic Prediction
  • Seamless Integration with OData Consumption
  • Enhanced Extensibility with Extensibility AI Assistant for SAP Cloud ERP Public
  • The Migration Revolution: Custom Code Migration AI Assistant for SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025

 

The Game-Changer: ABAP Cloud Application Generation

John's latest project required a library application with multiple entities. Opening his package in ADT, he right-clicks and selects "Generate ABAP Repository Objects." The new OData UI Service from Scratch Wizard with Joule Chat appears.

"Create a library application with entities for branches, book stock, users and borrowing information. Generate the appropriate fields which fit the business case for the entities." John prompts.

Within seconds, Joule responds with a comprehensive proposal including all entities, fields, and relationships. One click on "Accept" and the wizard auto-populates all configuration fields. Minutes later, John has a complete, runnable RAP application with data model, behavior definitions, service bindings, and OData services ready for UI consumption.

Intelligent Business Logic with RAP Business Logic Prediction

But the magic doesn't stop at application generation. John's application needs sophisticated business logic ‚Äì validations for booking dates, automatic stock calculations, and borrowing permission determinations.

Navigating to his behavior implementation class, John finds empty method stubs for his determinations and validations. The RAP Predict Business Logic capability kicks in, understanding the entity structure, field relationships, and business context to generate complete validation logic within the method implementation.

"It's not just generating code," John marvels. "It's understanding the business context and implementing proper RAP patterns automatically."

Seamless Integration with OData Consumption

When John needs to integrate with external booking services, he opens his service consumption model and starts the Joule chat with the /consume slash command. The OData consumption capability generates complete, ready-to-use ABAP code for consuming OData calls via the OData Client Proxy, tailored to his specific service model. 

What used to take hours of documentation reading now happens in seconds with Joule providing example prompts and OData request generation.

Enhanced Extensibility with Extensibility AI Assistant for SAP Cloud ERP Public

As business requirements evolve, the Extensibility AI Assistant guides John through adding custom fields for regulatory compliance. It assists him in:

  • Creating Custom Fields for borrowing information
  • Finding Business Contexts for the right extension points
  • Enabling Usages where custom fields can be exposed in UIs, APIs, and analytical views
  • Enabling Business Scenarios for data flow between business objects
  • Finding Value Help Views for code list-based custom fields
  • Finding BAdIs based on natural language input

The Migration Revolution: Custom Code Migration AI Assistant for SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025

With the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 release, John faces his organization's biggest challenge: migrating 15 years of custom ECC code to SAP ERP Cloud Private 2025. The Custom Code Migration AI Assistant will transforms this experience (on October 2025 planned release).  These use cases are currently not available on the older releases, however the use cases delivered on 2025 versions will be soon provided also as part of the Custom Code Migration Application which is a standalone BTP ABAP environment (Steampunk) application which can connect freely to any ERP OnPrem or Cloud system to support RISE migrations. 

  • Using the Explain Capability: "Explain this legacy report," John types, selecting a 500-line ABAP program. The Explain capability provides detailed explanations of the ABAP program, breaking down complex concepts with support for ABAP classes, ABAP programs, and CDS artifacts. 
  • Explain ATC Findings Capability: When running ATC checks with S/4HANA readiness variants, John uses the Explain ATC Findings capability on his S/4HANA readiness findings. This capability provides detailed explanations and step by step resolution proposal on ATC findings from check variants for SAP S/4HANA Readiness, specifically for: S/4HANA: Field Length Extensions, S/4HANA: Search for Database Operations and S/4HANA: Search for Usages and Simplified Objects. Each finding links to simplification items, which Joule explains in detail.
  • Documentation Migration Assistance: Using the Custom Code Migration AI Assistant, John opens the Joule chat view,  type in /docs to start chatting about simplification items related to Custom Code Migration and ABAP SAP Help documentation.  To chat with the assistant about SAP S/4HANA simplification items and Custom Code Migration, just start asking topic-related questions. 
  • With Code proposal for code adaptation coming in SAP S/4HANA 2025 FPS01, John will soon receive in addition of the step-by-step description of how to solve the ATC findings provided currently by ATC Explain functionality and a custom code adaptation automatically. 

The Complete ABAP Lifecycle Revolution

John's journey now encompasses the entire ABAP development and transformation lifecycle:

  • Build new cloud applications with OData UI Service from Scratch Wizard
  • Implement intelligent business logic with RAP Predict Business Logic
  • Integrate seamlessly with OData consumption
  • Extend dynamically with Extensibility AI Assistant in SAP Cloud ERP Public
  • Transform existing solutions with Custom Code Migration AI Assistant for RISE in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025

John tells now to everyone: "Six months ago, I was struggling with syntax," John explains to his manager. "Today, I'm generating complete applications with the OData UI Service from Scratch Wizard, implementing business logic with RAP Predict Business Logic, consuming services with OData consumption, extending solutions with the Extensibility AI Assistant, and leading our S/4HANA migration with the Custom Code Migration AI Assistant ‚Äì all through natural language conversations."

The impact is transformative:

  • Application Development: Dramatically faster with ABAP Cloud Application Generation
  • Business Logic Implementation: Massive reduction in development time
  • Migration Analysis: From weeks to hours using Custom Code Migration AI Assistant
  • OData Integration: Significantly less code required for side-by-side extension scenarios

 

The AI Revolution Accelerates ‚Äì Chapter 2 Awaits! John's incredible transformation is just the beginning as we enter the next phase of ABAP AI evolution. Even more exciting, SAP is pioneering a revolutionary side-by-side ABAP AI service that will bring full AI capabilities to older SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition releases, enabling immediate access to new AI innovations without waiting for upgrades or support packages across hybrid landscapes. Get ready for TechEd 2025 where all the groundbreaking details of this hybrid AI service will be unveiled ‚Äì the future of ABAP development is about to get even more transformative!

Ready to evolve your ABAP development approach? Check out the hands-on documentation in SAP Help and join the growing community redefining what's possible in enterprise development.

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Table Maintenance Reimagined: Choosing the Right Framework
entry.content:
In this blog, we‚Äôll explore a practical use case implemented in S/4HANA 2021 On-Premise, where we opted for Custom Business Objects (CBO) to enable table maintenance via Fiori with minimal development effort and also evaluate new frameworks to achieve this in latest S4/HANA release 2023.

Approach for choosing Custom Business Object (Decision Matrix)

CBO is based on BOPF framework which was widely used by SAP before the era of RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming), while this is still relevant, SAP has now moved to RAP based development and a new concept called custom business configuration, both will be covered later in context of data maintenance.

Why we didn‚Äôt choose RAP or Custom business configuration for this use case.
  1. Custom business configuration ( Business configuration maintenance object ) ‚Äì This is available from S4 On-Prem 2022 onwards and the Fiori app for CUBCO is available after 2023 onwards.
  2. RESTful ABAP Programming ‚Äì SAP has provided RAP Generator which can generate all the artefacts based on a table right from views, behavior definition , service binding , generation to Fiori app however this is also not available in On-Prem 2021, the other workaround could be to build all these artefacts manually and generate Fiori app which was going to take more development time, hence it was avoided.

Since we cannot go with above 2 options, the only 2 options left are SM30 and Custom Business object, as we want to move towards Fiori first approach, Custom business object was chosen as the Go to approach. Let us deep dive in this with the help of use- case and practical tips

What is Custom Business Object ‚Äì

With the Custom Business Objects Fiori app, you can create and manage custom business objects. A custom business object is a hierarchical set of database tables with an API for creation, retrieval, update and deletion of data.

  • In The Fiori App ‚ÄòCustom Business Object‚Äô, a new BO has been defined and maintained as below.
  • User can choose what options do they want as part of framework, e,g, Change document, system admin date (last change at, created at etc are added by default).
  • User interface is disabled in this since it is only possible to enable if Embedded gateway is used which is not the case here.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

You are free to choose what kind of operations, out of CUD, should be supported in the BO out of box.

This is where all the fields are defined for BO.

Final Output ‚Äì

Until this point, no coding has been done except for few changes in CDS Metadata for Fiori UI related cosmetic changes, all the operation are handled by framework out of box.

An additional button ‚ÄòMass upload‚Äô was added in metadata extension which is using intent-based navigation to navigate to another GUI application for mass upload of the entries.

Few Tips -
  1. Custom Table (Type Application) is auto generated in this case with Key field as UUID.
  2. Data entries maintained in one system cannot be transported to other system and must be maintained in target system, which was also the requirement in our use case.
  3. Once business object is published and moved to production, Deletion is not allowed.

How does the future look like for the same activity (Table Maintenance)-

As discussed above, there are 2 other ways to achieve this with minimal development efforts in new S4 HANA releases.

  1. Custom Business Configuration

    This is recommended approach going forward where a business configuration maintenance object serves as primary entry point for maintenance.
  • We have the option to use the Generate ABAP Repository Objects Wizard for Business configuration maintenance object to generate all required development objects based on a customizing table
  • Based on the Business configuration maintenance object, the custom business configurations app renders a Fiori element list report for the entities exposed by the service binding to maintain the configuration entries

Image courtesy - SAP

In short, Custom business configuration (Fiori app) is an umbrella under which all maintenance objects will be listed and serves as one stop shop while maintenance objects are the actual ABAP artefact which contains all the definition related to Object maintenance.

  • Different options like SM30 are available by default such Add copy action out of box.
  • Add Data Consistency Check for fields with fixed domain values or foreign key screen check.

All of the below objects are created by default including CDS view, service definition, service binding, business object maintenance , transport definition, implementation classes etc.

Final Output - 

Until this point, no coding has been done; all these features are provided out of the box by the framework.

The custom business configuration app shows all the maintenance objects for which the user is authorized.

Once the relevant maintenance object is selected, the Edit button would be enabled to allow creation, deletion, updation, etc. activities.

Few Practical Tips ‚Äì
  • All tables must have a client key field and delivery class C
  • Have a timestamp field with data element ABP_LASTCHANGE_TSTMPL
  • To enable the "No Transport" option in the ADT wizard, implement SAP Note  https://me.sap.com/notes/3579012.
  • With few tweaks, it is possible to maintain data directly in production system instead of transporting. More details in this blog

As of version SAP S/4HANA release 2022, customers can use the generator for Business Configuration objects. The Custom Business Configurations SAP Fiori app is not yet available; app has been made available in release 2023.

2. RAP Generator 

Second approach to achieve this is using same generation wizard from context menu of table.

How is Custom business configuration different than plain RAP generator?
  • Custom business configuration is a framework which is also built on RAP artefacts, but it has other framework related functionalities (e.g change log for auditing) in comparison to plain RAP application.
  • Fiori for CBC can be accessed through generic custom business configuration app serving as single source of entry whereas RAP application should be exposed as standalone app.
  • Custom business configuration app is built only around customizing tables whereas RAP generator can be built around any customizing and application tables both.
  • CBC provides in built functionality to capture entries into transport request, but RAP generator requires explicit changes to incorporate transport feature.
How is Custom business configuration different than custom business object?
  • Custom business configuration is built on RAP framework (SAP recommended) whereas custom business objects is built on BOPF framework.
  • Custom business configuration has transport feature for data entries whereas custom business object does not any way to transport entries from one system to other system.
  • Custom business configuration is bottom-up approach where custom tables are defined first, and rest of the artifacts are generated around that whereas custom business object works on top-down approach where business object is created first then custom table is generated around BO.
  • Custom business configuration supports only OData V4 where CBO supports OData V2.
  • Custom business configuration app is built only around customizing tables whereas custom business object is built around application tables.
  • Once CBO has moved to production, it cannot be deleted.
  • In both the case, Metadata can be enhanced for any Fiori related UI changes, also additional validation, actions are supported in both.

Additional reading-

  • https://help.sap.com/docs/ABAP_PLATFORM_NEW/b5670aaaa2364a29935f40b16499972d/047e01c3bcdd4303a60b61364bd5b31d.html?locale=en-US&version=202310.002
  • https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/custom-business-configuration/ba-p/13647767

entry.title: Understanding the Distinct Scope of SAP Cloud ERP Private
entry.content:
As organisations evaluate deployment options for their ERP systems, SAP Cloud ERP Private are often compared without taking the full scope of services into account. Yet, its unique architecture and comprehensive service model make direct comparisons challenging - and frequently misleading.

Traditional comparisons tend to overlook many of the embedded services that come standard with SAP Cloud ERP Private and ignore many of the available options, inadvertently giving other deployment models an apparent advantage. This not only skews perception but also obscures the full value SAP delivers out of the box.

To bring clarity to this discussion, we highlight the key services included in SAP Cloud ERP Private. Our goal is to empower customers with a clear understanding of what they receive, helping them make informed decisions based on a complete picture.

Modernise your ERP system while retaining your investment

SAP aims to transition all customers using SAP ERP to SAP S/4HANA by 2027. Before the introduction of RISE with SAP in 2021, SAP did not fully meet the needs of customers seeking cloud-based ERP solutions. The primary option available was S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition, which required a new implementation. This was not a viable option for many existing SAP ERP customers who wanted to retain their investment in their current systems, leverage existing data, and carry forward customizations and modifications.

To address this gap, SAP introduced SAP Cloud ERP Private solutions with the launch of RISE with SAP. These single-tenant solutions offer each customer their own dedicated instance of SAP software, hosted on separate infrastructure within a data center operated by one of the major hyperscalers or SAP itself. Existing SAP ERP customers can choose to either lift-and-shift their SAP ERP systems or transition to SAP Cloud ERP Private using a system conversion, selective data transition, or a new implementation approach.

With SAP Cloud ERP Private, SAP is taking away the complexity of designing, building and operating SAP software for our customers. We're doing this by providing a user or metric-based subscription model that includes the software and tooling license, infrastructure and technical managed services - everything that you need to run an SAP solution.

SAP Design, Build and Operate the entire SAP technical solution stack

SAP Enterprise Cloud Services (ECS), the business unit in SAP who is responsible for design, build and operate of Cloud ERP Private, delivers a robust framework for operating SAP Cloud ERP Private solutions, combining infrastructure, software licensing, and technical managed services into a unified subscription model. This approach simplifies the complexity of running SAP systems in a private cloud while ensuring enterprise-grade performance, security, and compliance.

SAP ECS invests heavily in capabilities that ensure robust system design, rapid setup and delivery, and a high degree of automation for operational tasks. This section outlines the key activities performed by SAP ECS, categorized into three phases - Design, Build, and Operate.

The diagram below highlights the key cost elements covered in SAP Cloud ERP Private for the design, build and operation of SAP, while customers retain the responsibility and control of the application layer throughout the three phases. This is valid for every implementation and every time technical changes are made to the SAP system landscape, reducing technical tasks for customers so they can focus more on the business:

The SAP Cloud ERP Private service cover key cost elements for the setup and operation of SAP

The process of designing, building and operating SAP requires broad areas of technical expert competence and requires answers to many detailed technical questions necessary to make strong architecture design decisions. In SAP Cloud ERP Private, this complexity is moved away from being a customer responsibility to the responsibility of SAP and SAP will have the answers during the design, build and operate phases.

1. Design Phase

The primary goal of the Design phase activities is to define standard and configurable cloud-based architectures for SAP ERP systems that enable rapid deployment, customer choice to cater to their unique requirements and minimum manual overhead while meeting SAP‚Äôs stringent availability, Recovery Time Objective (RTO), and Recovery Point Objective (RPO), Service Level Agreements (SLAs), security and compliance standards. SAP ECS periodically reviews and refines these architectures and operational processes considering improvements in Hyperscaler infrastructure capabilities, 3rd party tools and services and SAP ECS‚Äôs own operational experience.

There are several complex topics that need to be addressed during this phase:

  • Which hyperscaler building blocks to use?
  • Which virtual machine instances are the right fit and certified by SAP?
  • What is the security design?
  • How can business continuity be achieved?
  • How should the systems be monitored?
  • How can resources be effectively scaled?
  • What is the architecture design?

Key activities performed by SAP ECS as part of the Design phase:

  • Reference Architectures: SAP collaborates with hyperscalers to define scalable, secure cloud architectures using SAP best practices.
  • Security & Compliance: Network isolation, encryption, intrusion detection, and adherence to ISO/NIST standards.
  • Monitoring & Incident Response System: Proactive incident response systems and tailored architecture advisory services ensure resilience and performance.
  • Cloud Architecture & Advisory: SAP collaborates with customers to define optimal technical architecture, considering each customer‚Äôs system sizing, cloud security, networking and technical integration, and business continuity requirements. SAP and customers jointly engage in a Technical Assessment process to ensure the non-functional requirements are met in SAP Cloud ERP Private.

For every SAP ERP customer moving to SAP Cloud ERP Private solutions, an SAP advisory team which is part of ECS (SAP Cloud Architecture & Advisory (CAA) which provides the above Cloud Architecture & Advisory services) or a similar partner advisory team, analyzes customer requirements and determines the best suitable configuration for the customer. By leveraging pre-defined standard and configurable cloud-based architectures defined by SAP, the time taken to define the architectures for each customer is significantly reduced and the decision process is simplified.

2. Build Phase

The primary goal of the Build phase activities is to define how to install, configure and validate the systems
that have been designed. There are several complex topics that need to be addressed during this phase:

  • Which tools should be used?
  • How to ensure systems are built to provide optimal performance?
  • How to migrate existing workloads?
  • How to ensure implementation best practices are followed?
  • How to reduce the deployment time?
  • How to technically validate the new infrastructure?
  • How to ensure proper governance to manage issues?

SAP has created a global framework for the build phase that spans the multi-cloud Infrastructure ecosystem.
This framework covers best practices for migration into the cloud, automated provisioning, deployment, and
validation of SAP systems. This allows our customers to safely adopt and run new SAP software innovations
because cloud services are tested and made production-ready before they are made available to customers.

  • Datacenter facilities, physical hardware and connectivity
  • Infrastructure Provisioning: Certified compute, storage, and network components are deployed using automated tools and DevOps methodologies.
  • Technical Managed Services required to build and deliver the infrastructure
  • Software Stack: SAP installs and configures OS, databases, and ERP applications, including industry best practices.
  • Operational Tooling: Licensing and integration of provisioning, monitoring, backup, and cybersecurity tools.

3. Operate Phase

The primary goal of the operate phase is to provide ongoing support, infrastructure management, change
management and the technical services necessary to run the application. There are several complex topics
that need to be addressed during this phase:

  • How should the SLAs be measured?
  • How to manage the changes?
  • How to automate and achieve operational efficiency?
  • How to manage security incidents and threats?
  • How to keep SAP applications up-to-date?
  • How to address capacity planning?

SAP Enterprise Cloud Services accelerates and simplifies customers‚Äô business transformation by running their SAP systems with a world-class level of availability, security and resilience, supported by an application-level SLA and a managed cloud service tailored to SAP systems. After a successful transition from the build phase to the operate phase, the ongoing support work is performed, along with additional application deployment activities. It covers the management of the installed infrastructure and applications, scaling the infrastructure, and managing ITIL processes through an engagement model with proven governance to secure business continuity.

  • Datacenter & Capacity Management: Continuous infrastructure optimization, backup integrity, and disaster recovery planning.
  • Security Operations: 24/7 threat detection, patching, vulnerability scanning, and advanced forensics.
  • Service Management: ITIL-based workflows, global support teams, and dedicated technical service managers ensure SLA adherence and business continuity.

Selecting the right deployment for your ERP system

Through SAP's Technical Assessment process, we work closely with each customer to address all questions related to the design, build, and operation of SAP in Cloud ERP Private. During this assessment, SAP provides detailed insights into the cloud service elements and explains the available options for transitioning to SAP Cloud ERP Private.

One such option is SAP S/4HANA Cloud Safekeeper, which helps customers extend support for their existing S/4HANA systems, ensuring business continuity: Bridging the gap with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Safekeeper

SAP ECS empowers enterprises to move legacy ERP systems to private cloud environments without compromising control, compliance, or customisation. Our private cloud strategy serves as a blueprint for scalable, secure, and intelligent ERP modernisation.

entry.title: Feedback on Joule
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community Members,

 

Recently, we have deployed Joule in our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. We found the performance is disappointing. Although we have raised several support tickets to SAP OSS, it is very time consuming (We have found a lot of issues, including transactional capabilities, navigational capabilities, and informational capabilities when testing it), and it seems currently there is no official way for us to share our feedback about Joule. (We cannot find Joule on the Customer Influence Portal)

 

The following are the issues of Joule‚Äôs navigational capabilities. 

Note: I have added all standard roles in IAS and suppose it is not an authorization issue.

 

Issue 1: Cannot provide Navigation Link

Please see the following surprising conversation with Joule.

We ask ‚ÄúFiori App to create PO‚Äù. Joule cannot provide the navigation link for such Fiori Apps.

When we ask ‚ÄúApp to create PO‚Äù, Joule can provide the navigation link.

 

Issue 2: Does not support GUI transactions

We understand that navigational capabilities only support Fiori Apps. However, I hope SAP Joule will provide navigation capabilities for GUI transactions in the future. Otherwise, we will face the following issue.

We ask ‚ÄúApp for Clearing Open Item Automatically‚Äù. Although no Fiori app is for F.13, it should not suggest F2223 (Reset Cleared Items)

It will only show the correct result if we ask for tcode.

Then we ask ‚ÄúApp for Open MM Period‚Äù Joule will provide irrelevant Fiori apps. including F2293 (Open FI Period) and F4684 (Open CO Period) when no Fiori app is for opening MM period. 

 

If we ask the same question again, Joule will provide a weird query to us

 

We have tested a lot of Joule‚Äôs Base capabilities. Most users feel frustrated with its performance. My comment is ‚ÄúJoule is a product with unlimited potential. However, currently it is still at an early stage.‚Äù I believe Joule will perform much and much better when our feedback can reach the SAP Joule Product Team.

 

Thanks for your reading, 

Chak

entry.title: How to set up Withholding Tax in Treasury Using Extended Withholding Tax
entry.content:
This blog describes setup of the withholding tax using integration from SAP Treasury and Risk Management (treasury) to the extended withholding tax in Financial Accounting. Besides the calculation and accounting this integration also ensures that corresponding withholding tax information is added to the resulting accounting documents. Such documents are included in standard legal reports in a given country. There are also other possibilities to calculate and account withholding taxes, e.g. using derived flows, however the resulting documents usually lack all the necessary withholding tax information.

Pre-delivered configuration in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud enables posting to supplier. However, this example scenario covers withholding tax on incoming interests in money market instruments posted to customer to describe all configuration steps. 

We focus on the configuration and master data related to withholding tax, we expect that you have already completed general setup for treasury and for the extended withholding tax in Financial Accounting.

 

1          Customizing Prerequisites

The withholding tax code and tax type are defined in Financial Accounting.

If the withholding tax code is defined as Payment Time, the system generates the withholding tax only at the time of payment in the transaction F110 (Automatic Payment). In this case, treasury generates only an empty flow and a corresponding item for table WITH_ITEM with withholding tax base amount.

If the withholding tax code is defined as Invoice Time, the system generates the withholding tax line item in the accounting document of the interest. Treasury then generates a flow with withholding tax amount.

 

2          Customizing in Treasury

2.1       Define Update Type for Withholding Tax

In our example we use update type TAXWH01.

2.2       Define Account Determination for Interest

The extended withholding tax requires posting to supplier/customer, therefore it is necessary to set up account determination for interest in treasury accordingly.

2.2.1     Posting Specification

It contains document type for posting on customer and GL account. The posting key for debit entry is for customer, and the account symbol has posting category for subledger posting in payment currency.

2.2.2     Assign Update Type to Posting Specification

It is important to mark the indication Payment Transaction in the assignment of the update type to posting specification.

2.3       Specify Flow Attributes for Extended Withholding Tax

In this activity we assign the withholding tax update type to the interest update type.

Note. Only maintain key fields that are relevant for the actual interest flow. If you maintain securities account for interest from money market instrument, the configuration won‚Äôt be selected in the processing, because money market instrument doesn‚Äôt carry securities account.

If you have a scenario with interest for securities do not maintain transaction type, because interests in securities account management (transaction TPM40) don‚Äôt carry transaction type.

The assignment also contains the withholding tax type and withholding tax code.

 

3          Business Partner Master Data

The withholding tax data are maintained in the corresponding tab Customer: Withholding Tax        

Note that the withholding tax and withholding tax code must be same as in the activity Specify Flow Attributes for Extended Withholding Tax. Also, the indicator withholding tax agent must be set.

 

4         Processing of the financial transaction

4.1       Create Financial Transaction

Enter the money market transaction as usual. On payment details page, it is crucial that the interest is posted to customer and without payment request:

 

The generated planned withholding tax isn‚Äôt visible directly under the Cash Flow tab. You can check it in the transaction TPM13 Treasury Position Flows ‚Äì Classic

Note that this is only planned withholding tax. In some cases, the withholding tax can depend on some limits related to the business partner, and so the resulting withholding tax at the time of posting can differ. The cash flow in TPM13 serves as a good indication whether everything is set up correctly and the withholding tax is generated.

4.2       Post financial transaction

The withholding tax is posted together with the interest in the transaction TBB1 (Fix, Pay, and Post Flows). There is a limitation in posting log, which puts withholding tax in two-line items, whereas resulting accounting document has only one line item for withholding tax.

For more information about the basic settings for withholding tax, see Withholding Tax in Treasury.

entry.title: Simulation for SAM4U Solution: Flexibility with the Accelerator for SAM4U Adoption
entry.content:
When adopting SAP SAM4U, one of the biggest challenges customers face is handling role, profile, and authorization changes without disrupting production. This is where the Accelerator for SAM4U Adoption brings real value, thanks to its simulation capabilities.

What Customers Expect from Authorization Simulation

With the simulation, customers get the ability to:

  • Log changes at the role or profile level on the system dataset.
  • Track and review roles and profiles that have been modified.
  • Revert changes at the role or profile level, either all at once or individually.
  • Modify user-to-role or user-to-profile assignments.
  • Perform mass unassignments of roles and profiles (e.g., removing SAP_ALL or SAP_NEW).
  • Identify and review changes made to users.
  • Revert user assignments back to their original state when needed.

 Pic. 01 Roles and Profiles Changes Tracking

 Pic. 02 Roles and Profiles Mass Unassignment

 Pic. 03 Changes to the Role Detailed Review

But that‚Äôs not all! The real power lies in managing simulation snapshots.

 Pic. 04 Snapshots of Simulations on the System‚Äôs Dataset Level

Why Simulation Snapshots Matter

Simulation snapshots are created at the system dataset level, allowing you to:

  • Save changes without applying them directly in production.
  • Create new consolidations from modified datasets.
  • Avoid repetitive, time-consuming rework when changes cannot be applied immediately.

Example: Working with Two Systems in Consolidation

Imagine you are analyzing two systems in a consolidation project. You make changes to roles and users in both systems. However, due to restrictions, you cannot yet apply changes in System A.

Without losing your work, you can:

  • Create a new consolidation using the dataset from System A and the modified snapshot from System B.
  • Or temporarily move the snapshot from System A into the dataset, and later reapply those changes when they are ready for production.

 Pic. 05 The Power of Management Snapshots and Datasets that are Used in Consolidation

This flexibility ensures you never have to redo your work and can manage changes efficiently.

Why Customers Prefer the Accelerator for SAM4U Adoption

Customers appreciate the simulation feature because it provides:

  • System-level flexibility to manage changes.
  • Easy-to-handle snapshots that can be created, reviewed, reverted, and reused.
  • No duplication of effort, once a change is made, it is saved and can be reapplied.
  • Reliable validation, you can reload fresh production data and check if changes were successfully implemented.

If changes were tracked only at the consolidation level, fresh data from the system would overwrite them. This is why the Accelerator focuses on system snapshots, giving customers full control to experiment, validate, and roll back whenever needed.

 Pic.06 Accelerator for SAM4U Adoption Dashboard for Simulation Results Analysis

With the Accelerator for SAM4U Adoption, simulation becomes not just a test environment, but a strategic tool for efficient and risk-free SAM4U adoption.

entry.title: Understanding Release Contracts (C0‚ÄìC3) in S/4HANA Repository Objects
entry.content:
Introduction

This blog is the first in a short series about extension and API stability in S/4HANA. In this post I‚Äôll explain release contracts (also known as stability contracts) ‚Äî what they are, why SAP uses them, and how they affect the objects you work with every day.

A Release Contract is a classification that indicates how stable a repository object is and how it can be used or extended. It‚Äôs SAP‚Äôs formal promise that certain objects will remain stable across upgrades. The goal is to strike a balance: on one hand, SAP keeps the system flexible so development can continue; on the other, key technical elements are kept stable so consumers don‚Äôt need to rewrite code after every upgrade.

To provide those guarantees, SAP defines different stability/release contracts (C0, C1, C2, ‚Ä¶). Each contract describes the intended scope of use ‚Äî for example, whether something is intended as a safe extension point, a stable in-system API, or a remote API for external callers.

Stability Contracts

       C0 : Contract for Extensions

       C1 : Contract for System Internal Use

       C2 : Contract for Remote API Use

       C3 : Manage Configuration Content

       C4 : Use in ABAP Managed Database Procedure ( Not covered in this blog )

Let us look at how these Contracts apply to comman repository Objects.

CDS Views : CDS views are one of the most common repository objects you‚Äôll come across in S/4HANA. SAP uses release contracts to make clear whether a CDS view can be extended, consumed inside the system, or even exposed to the outside world.

  • C0 - Extend

    • A C0 contract means the CDS view can be safely extended
    • There are two main ways to extend
      • Key user Extensibility : add your own custom fields (or sometimes even make standard fields available) using the Custom Fields app in FIORI.
      • Developer Extensibility : Use ABAP Development Tools (ADT) to create a CDS view extension. This lets you add fields or annotations to the view in a controlled way.
    • The promise here is that the structure of the view won‚Äôt change in a way that breaks your code across upgrades.

            

  • C1 - System Internal Use

    • A C1 contract means the CDS view is a stable API for internal consumption.

    • You can safely use a C1 released CDS in :
      • Key user Extensibility : For Analytical Queries, Custom CDS Views
      • Developer Extensibility : In Custom ABAP code in ABAP Cloud or S/4 HANA Cloud.
    • In both cases, the base CDS view provides stable ‚Äúanchors‚Äù where your extensions will survive upgrades.

          

  • C2 - Remote APIs

    • Sometimes the data in a CDS view isn‚Äôt just needed internally, but also by external systems.

    • In those cases, SAP exposes the CDS via an OData service (or other service binding).
    • When a CDS view is published for remote consumption, it carries a C2 contract. This ensures the external API is technically stable for side-by-side or third-party integrations.

                

 

Database Tables : Database tables are the lowest-level repository objects in the system. In Practice SAP most often delivers these with C3 ( Manage Configuration Content ).

Tables can also be prepared by the provider for C0 ( Developer Extensibility ) using specific Annotation and release state settings - but this is an opt-in decision design. Most standard tables are not exposed this way , because SAP prefers that extensions happen via CDS views.

The release contract you‚Äôll find for tables is C3 ‚Äì Manage Configuration Content.

  • C3 - Manage Configuration Content

    • A C3 contract means the table is intended for storing configuration data (for example, customizing or setup values).
    • With C3, SAP promises that the persistence and structure of the table will remain stable so that tools can reliably export, import, or transport configuration across systems.
  • Why Not C0 or C1 for tables ?
    • No C1: Tables are not meant to be consumed directly in ABAP Cloud development. If you need business data, you should always go through a released CDS view
    • C0 possible but rare : SAP does allow tables to be released with C0 if explicitly enabled by the provider (using annotations), but most delivered tables are not. Instead, SAP recommends CDS views or the Custom Fields app for extensibility. 

          

 

Behavior Defination ( RAP Business Object ) : Behavior definitions describe what you can do with a business object in RAP (the RESTful ABAP Programming Model) ‚Äî things like creating, updating, deleting, running validations, or triggering actions. 

Unlike CDS views, most SAP-delivered behavior definitions are released with C1 (System-Internal Use). A C0 contract for behavior definitions is technically possible (the framework supports it if the provider enables extension anchors), but in practice it is rare. You should always check the API State in ADT to see what‚Äôs allowed.

  • C1 - System Internal Use

    • A C1 contract means the business object is safe to consume inside the system, but not open for developer extensions. 
    • You Can :
      • Call the BO‚Äôs actions and operations in your own ABAP Cloud code.
      • Bind the BO to a Fiori Elements app and use it in your custom applications.
      • Rely on its structure to remain stable across upgrades.

 

Conclusion

This blog focused on SAP-delivered objects and how SAP marks their stability (C0‚ÄìC3): CDS views (C0 for extension, C1 for in-system use, C2 for remote APIs), behavior definitions (generally C1 for consumption; C0 only if explicitly enabled), and database tables (commonly C3 for configuration; tables can also be prepared for C0, but that is opt-in).. Although there are other blogs that go deep into specific object types, this post is meant as a pre-read to give you the holistic view. And if you want to actually find released objects and their contracts, the magic lies in the System Library in ADT ‚Äî and how you configure the tree.

entry.title: SAP Datasphere Integration with SAP S/4HANA: SAP Cloud Connector Setup Guide
entry.content:
Introduction: 

In this article, we will explore SAP Cloud Connector what it is, its purpose, and the scenarios where it becomes essential. Whether you are working with SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud or connecting SAP S/4HANA on-premise systems to the cloud, the SAP Cloud Connector plays a critical role. We will also provide a step-by-step guide on its configuration and setup, helping you seamlessly bridge your on-premise and SAP Datasphere cloud environments.

What is SAP Cloud Connector?

The SAP Cloud Connector acts as a secure link between SAP Datasphere and on-premises systems, enabling seamless integration without exposing your entire internal network (behind the firewall). It runs as an on-premises agent or middleware in a secured environment and functions as a reverse invoke proxy, providing controlled access to selected systems and resources. 

Key benefits include fine-grained control over which on-premises systems cloud applications can access, automatic recovery of broken connections, and audit logging of inbound traffic and configuration changes. It also supports high-availability setups for enterprise scenarios.

Compared to opening firewall ports or using DMZ reverse proxies, the Cloud Connector is easier and safer to deploy. It supports multiple protocols, including HTTP and RFC for native ABAP system access, and allows secure propagation of cloud user identities to on-premises systems. With simple installation, low TCO, and standard SAP support, it‚Äôs an efficient solution for connecting cloud and on-premises landscapes.

Does it support data encryption ?

Yes, TLS encryption is used for the tunnel

What are the SAP Datasphere data integration features, and in which scenarios is the SAP Cloud Connector required?

  • Replication Flows ‚Äì For example, connecting to SAP ABAP CDS views and replicating data to the cloud.
  • Data Flows ‚Äì For scenarios like extracting, transforming, and loading data from on-premises sources, including SAP ABAP CDS views.
  • Model Import ‚Äì Importing existing ABAP CDS data models from on-premises systems into SAP Datasphere for further analytics and integration.

SAP Cloud Connector FAQs

Where can I find information about SAP Cloud Connector licensing, downloading, and installation ?

  • 2827108 - SAP Cloud Connector licensing, download and installation information.
  • It does not required separate license and it is free to use.
  • Download: SAP Cloud Connector.
  • Installation and Setup.

What are the Sizing Recommendations? 

  • Sizing for the Master Instance
  • Sizing for the Shadow Instance

What are the best practices and recommendations for setting up SAP Cloud Connector?

  • Always Use the Latest Version: Install or update to the latest Cloud Connector release to take advantage of new features and security improvements.
  • Dedicated Server Setup: Install on a dedicated server within your corporate network that has direct, unblocked access to the source system. Ideally, this server should be physically close to the source systems it connects to.
  • High Availability Setup:
    • Master (Primary Installation): Main Cloud Connector instance for normal or HA setups.
    • Shadow (Backup Installation): Secondary instance for HA, providing failover support.
  • Environment-Specific Installations: recommended to have a separate Cloud Connector for each environment (development, testing, production) to ensure stability and isolation.
  • User Configuration: Use an email ID linked to the subaccount or global account instead of an S-User for easier management.
  • Proper Sizing: Ensure the server has sufficient resources (CPU, memory, network bandwidth) to handle the expected load.
  • Regular Log Review: Continuously monitor logs and metrics to detect performance issues or connectivity problems and resolve them promptly.

SAP Cloud Connector Troubleshooting Guides:

  • Common Issues and Guided Answers.
  • Logs and Troubleshooting.
  • 3369433 - How to troubleshoot Cloud Connector related issues when creating connection in SAP Datasphere

Steps to Install, Configure and Setup the SAP Cloud Connector:

Step 1: Download, Prerequisites, and Install the Cloud Connector

Before you begin configuration, make sure the following prerequisites are in place:

  • Download: SAP Cloud Connector.
  • The Cloud Connector is installed in your on-premise network. (See Cloud Connector Installation in the SAP BTP Connectivity documentation.)
  • If you‚Äôre using egress firewalling, add these domains to the firewall/proxy allowlist:
    •  *.hanacloud.ondemand.com
    • *.k8s-hana.ondemand.com
  • You need an SAP BTP account. If you don‚Äôt already have one, create it by registering in the SAP BTP cockpit.

Step 2: Launch and Login

  • After installation, an user:Administrator account is created with the initial password: manage (case-sensitive). You‚Äôll be prompted to change it on first login. Default/Initial login details Administrator / manage 

  • Access the Cloud Connector Administration at:
    https://<hostname>:8443 (replace <hostname> with the machine name, or use localhost if installed locally).

  • 2388242 - KBA: How to reset SAP Cloud Connector built-in user's password

Step 3: Add Your SAP BTP Subaccount

You‚Äôll need details from your SAP Datasphere subaccount:

  • Subaccount

  • Region Host ( Data Center - Providers and Regions)

  • Sub Account User (usually the email ID tied to your BTP account)

If account info is missing, enter your SAP BTP user ID manually. For troubleshooting, see KBA: 2397165.

2571763 - Authorization problem in SAP Cloud Connector when adding Cloud Foundry subaccount

For auth errors refer Log and Trace Files: scc_core.trc

Note: Initially SAP BTP Core account details in SAP Datasphere will not be available, you must provide the SAP BTP account email and save. SAP Datasphere tenant owner can perform this.

 

 

Step 4: Verify Connection

Once the subaccount is added, the status should display Connected.

 

Step 5: Configure the Cloud Connector

For this guide, we‚Äôll focus on Replication Flow scenarios using RFC and HTTPS protocols.

 

Step 6: Add the SAP S/4HANA (ABAP) System

  1. Select Cloud to On-Premise scenario and Back-end Type: ABAP System.

     

  2. Choose HTTPS protocol.

     

  3. Use without load balancing (application server + instance number).

     

  4. Enter your SAP S/4HANA internal host and port.

    How to find internal host and port from SAP S/4HANA ? (Run T-Code SMICM ‚Üí Services).

     

  5. Leaving defaults for principal propagation and system certificate. (check your requirement and change)

     

  6. Define a virtual host name (recommended: different from the internal name).

     

     

  7. Provide a System ID (e.g., RI4) and description, then finish setup.

     

  8. Test connectivity ‚Äì status should show Reachable.

     

  9. Add resources ‚Äì in this scenario, we added all resources under /.

     

Step 7: Add RFC Protocol Resources

  1. Select RFC protocol.

     

  2. Enter system mapping details (System ID + description).

     

  3. Finish setup and test connectivity.

     

      

  4. Map required resources:

     

    • With Prefix (e.g., DHAMB_)

        

    • With Exact Name (e.g., RFC_FUNCTION_SEARCH)

       

  5. Ensure the status turns Green for all resources.

     

Step 8: Maintain IP Allow list in SAP Datasphere

  1. Identify the public IP address of the host where Cloud Connector is installed (e.g., via whatismyip.com or ip.me or whatever way you are aware of).

     

  2. Add this IP under Trusted Cloud Connector IPs in SAP Datasphere:
    System ‚Üí Configuration ‚Üí IP Allowlist.

     

Step 9: Maintain the Cloud Connector Location ID in SAP Datasphere

Go to:
SAP Datasphere ‚ÜíSystem ‚Üí Administration ‚Üí Data Source Configuration and maintain the Cloud Connector Location ID.

 

 

With these steps completed, your SAP Cloud Connector is successfully installed, connected, and configured to integrate and create a native connection type of SAP S/4HANA on-premise with SAP Datasphere.

Summary: 

In this blog, we saw how the SAP Cloud Connector helps connect SAP Datasphere with on-premise systems in a secure and easy way. It supports features like Replication Flows, Data Flows, and Model Import for smooth data integration. We also looked at the benefits such as simple setup, better security, high availability, and low cost. With best practices like keeping it updated, using a dedicated server, and regular monitoring, you can ensure reliable performance. Finally, we walked through the step-by-step setup to successfully link SAP S/4HANA with SAP Datasphere.

entry.title: From Backlogs to Breakthroughs: What ABAP AI Means for Project Delivery
entry.content:
Hello everyone ! I am Shruthi, a Project Manager of BTP ABAP AI, and I am just about to celebrate my first anniversary with my team. Looking back at this past year, I feel so grateful for the people I work with, the projects we have delivered, and the way we have grown together. 

One thing I have noticed time and again is how small changes‚Äîlike a new validation rule, a UI tweak, or a simple workflow adjustment‚Äîcan have a huge impact for business users. But these ‚Äúsmall‚Äù requests often take longer than expected because they get caught in processes and development backlogs. 

That is why the recent blogs on ABAP AI and the Extensibility Assistant really resonate with me. They show how SAP is already delivering tools that make development faster and extensibility safer. 

Key Highlights You Should Explore 

Here are some excellent resources that set the stage for this journey: 

  •  @Simona Marincei‚Äôs Blog: ABAP AI Revolution: Accelerates the ABAP Developer Who Built Enterprise Apps 
  • @GeorgWilhelm‚Äôs Blog :  Extensibility Assistant for Key Users: The Extensibility Expert Right Next to You 
  • @AlexanderRother‚Äôs Blog:  ABAP AI Chapter 2 
  •  Joule for Developers ‚Äì YouTube Playlist 

Joule for Developers, ABAP AI Capabilities ‚Äì Free and Ready to Use 

One of the most exciting developments for us right now is Joule for Developers, ABAP AI Capabilities. It is available for free usage today and brings AI-powered assistance directly into the hands of developers. 

With Joule for Developers, you can: 

  • Generate and refactor ABAP code with AI guidance. 
  • Explore sample data and learning materials. 
  • Speed up everyday development tasks and reduce repetitive work. 
  • Access tutorials and demos from the YouTube playlist. 
  • For teams like mine, this is a real enabler‚Äîit means we are not just talking about AI as the future, we are using it today to accelerate delivery and learn new ways of working. 

What We Are Experiencing 

In my role, I see these tools helping in very practical ways: 

  • Business users get changes rolled out more quickly. 
  • Developers focus on high-value, complex scenarios. 
  • Projects move forward with smoother coordination. 

The result is a stronger partnership between IT and the business, and a better experience for everyone involved. 

Final Thought 

  • ABAP AI today is already making a difference‚Äîit accelerates development, empowers key users, and ensures safe extensibility with built-in governance. And with Joule for Developers ABAP AI Capabilities now free to use, every developer has the chance to explore AI-powered assistance directly. 
  • For me and my team, this means more delivered outcomes, happier stakeholders, and projects that stay on track. 

As I celebrate one year with this fantastic team, I look forward to what the next chapter will bring. The journey of ABAP AI is still unfolding, and I am excited to see where it takes us.  

 I would love to hear your thoughts: how are you using ABAP AI in your projects, and what impact has it had so far?

entry.title: Plant abroad scenario of Inbound Message Handler for Poland solution
entry.content:
This blog post is intended to describe the enablement of plant abroad scenario of Inbound Message Handler on both SAP S/4HANA and SAP ERP releases for Poland.

PLEASE NOTE: the plant abroad scenario can only be executed when the company code belongs to a different country if compared to the country assigned to the message type.


Disclaimer: The plant abroad scenario only works if the new features of Inbound Message Handler are activated. Please check below:

In SAP S/4HANA and SAP ERP

SM30 ‚Üí EDOGENCUSTV

Country-specific steps to be executed

Steps to be executed by either country teams or customer inhouse developers *

In  SAP S/4HANA and SAP ERP

Create/edit an entry for the new/existing message type:

S4H OP 2023 and 2022

S4H 2021 and lower

EDOM

SM30 ‚Üí EDOMSGTYPEV

Assign it to the country, select the Message Group "Pulling" , Message Type "PL_KSEF_QRY_MSG_PULL" and "PL_KSEF_SESSION_PULL" and flag the ‚ÄúPlant abroad‚Äù checkbox:

EDOM:

 

SM30 ‚Üí EDOMSGTYPEV

 

Inbound Message Handler Report (TA EDOC_INBOUND_MSG)

The flag becomes available for use and the scenario can be executed.

This is how you enable the plants abroad scenario for Poland in the Inbound Message Handler.

entry.title: Embedded Finance in SAP: SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity with J.P. Morgan Payments
entry.content:
Enterprises are rethinking how to connect banking capabilities with ERP processes to maximize business value. Key questions include:

  • How to make payments, reconciliation, and cash visibility seamless and fully integrated between banks and the ERP system?
  • How to adopt innovations like real-time payments or real-time cash balances without launching a new IT project every time a banking service gets added?
  • How to unlock the combined value of invoice and payment data in the ERP alongside the cash and financial data held by banks?

SAP and J.P. Morgan asked themselves the same questions. And as a result decided to collaborate and partner even closer to bring more value to shared clients by better integrating the capabilities of both by accelerating adoption of SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity (MBC) to deliver J.P. Morgan bank services embedded in ERP processes.

With SAP MBC, corporates get direct, standardized access to J.P. Morgan banking services directly integrated into their payment and cash processes. As a result corporates can scale new services faster, without custom builds and with minimal ongoing maintenance and benefit from the seamless and many times real time data flow to get the decision advantage crucial in todays fast and ever changing business world.

What you can expect

  • Seamless connectivity: Integrate J.P. Morgan services via SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity to connect your SAP ERP to J.P. Morgan Payments using standardized, bank-approved channels.
  • Automate payments and reporting: The J.P. Morgan Payments Adapter 2.0 supports file-based payments (ACH, checks, virtual cards, wires‚Äîincluding FX) and real-time payments across the U.S., EU, UK, Australia, Singapore, Malaysia, and Hong Kong.
  • Real-time insights: Access instant reporting and reconciliation, view account balances and transaction details, and track payments through advanced APIs.
  • Easy implementation: Prebuilt adapters and help you go live quickly and securely
  • AI-powered treasury: Leverage SAP‚Äôs cloud data foundation and AI-driven capabilities to interact with J.P. Morgan and elevate treasury operations.

Who can benefit

  • New and existing J.P. Morgan clients using SAP S/4HANA (Public Cloud, Private Cloud, or On-Premise) or SAP ECC (6.0+)
  • Organizations operating on J.P. Morgan Access, with support for multi-bank reporting across non‚ÄìJ.P. Morgan DDAs
  • Teams seeking flexible connection options through SAP MBC to tailor integrations to specific business needs

This collaboration meets clients where they are simplifying connectivity while strengthening control and visibility at the same time, and accelerating access to new banking innovations, all embedded in SAP ERP processes.

Want to know more?

  • SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity 
    • https://www.sap.com/germany/products/financial-management/multi-bank-connectivity.html 
    • https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_MULTI_BANK_CONNECTIVITY
  • J.P. Morgan SAP Integration:
    • https://partners.jpmorgan.com/sap_s4hana.html
  • SAP and J.P. Morgan Partnership:
    • https://digital.jpmorgan.com/jpmorgan-with-sap/index.html

Still want to know more?

Meet us at the AFP Conference in Boston on October 26‚Äì29 or attend SAP and J.P. Morgan session at the AFP and J.P. Morgan Booth on Tuesday Oct 28th  2-2.30pm local Boston time

entry.title: SAP Sustainability Footprint Management: Q3-25 Updates & Highlights
entry.content:
In the past quarter, we continued delivering many more useful features and functions in SAP Sustainability Footprint Management, and we achieved great success stories together with our customers. This blog post continues my quarterly series and gives you an overview of some of the highlights. In this edition, I‚Äôm covering:

  • ERP-Centric Transport Footprint Calculation
  • Manage Footprint Results ‚Äì Source Input Items
  • GHG Data Collection API and SAP Build Process Automation
  • Onboarding Booster
  • Other Release Highlights
  • Customer Success Stories: KNAPP & Tyrolit
  • Upcoming Partner Webinars
  • Additional Information

 

ERP-Centric Transport Footprint Calculation

Transportation can be a major contributor to Scope 3 emissions, yet calculating its impact has mostly been complex and manual. With the new ERP‚Äëcentric transport footprint calculation, SAP Sustainability Footprint Management introduces a capability that leverages your existing ERP master and transactional data to automate and scale transport emission calculations. This means you can move from spreadsheets and estimates to actual, auditable results that integrate seamlessly into both corporate and product carbon footprints.

Instead of building transport models from scratch, the solution now derives upstream and internal transport activities from Goods Receipt from Supplier, Goods Return to Supplier, and Goods Transfer data, and then calculates the footprint per activity, route, and leg. In practical terms, a transport activity is determined as the movement of specific products in given quantities between two locations under defined conditions. The system brings together master data, transaction details, and transport settings to identify source and target locations, the mode of transport, and whether goods move under ambient or temperature-controlled conditions. It then builds optimal transport routes via connection points such as airports, seaports, inland ports, and railway stations, before applying the relevant emission factors to calculate the footprint.

 

In the following, I‚Äôll briefly summarize the required process steps and introduce the new apps. For detailed information, see Calculating Transport Footprints Using Business Transactions.

To use the new approach, start with importing transport-relevant master data, so routing and distances work out-of-the-box. Products now carry a Custom Temperature Condition, and SAP provides a default mapping to Ambient. If you need temperature-controlled transport, create your own custom conditions and map them to the standard values (Ambient or Temperature-Controlled). Locations and Plants now support addresses and geo-coordinates, and Business Partners can be imported with Supplier and Carrier roles, including address data tied to supplier IDs.

Then you can configure your inventory scope and in Transport Details set the Data Source to Standard (Business Transactions). Newly created scopes default to Standard, while existing scopes remain on Classic until you switch them.

For maintaining transport connection points ‚Äì like seaports, inland ports, airports, railway stations ‚Äì go to the Manage Locations app, where you already find SAP-delivered content for seaports and airports to help kick-start sea and air routes.
